paragraphs.title: Introduction
paragraphs.text:
%md

This Gaia science exploitation platform is built on [Apache Spark](https://spark.apache.org). The primary user interface is employs [Zeppelin notebooks](https://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.9.0/quickstart/explore_ui.html#note-layout) (similar to the possibly more familiar Jupyter notebook system) employing Python code and a suite of third-party packages and libraries for analysis, plotting, etc.

msg.data: This Gaia science exploitation platform is built on Apache Spark. The primary user interface is employs Zeppelin notebooks (similar to the possibly more familiar Jupyter notebook system) employing Python code and a suite of third-party packages and libraries for analysis, plotting, etc.

paragraphs.title: Familiarisation

msg.data:
The best way to familiarise yourself with this science exploitation platform is to examine the example notebooks that come bundled with it. These are:

  • “Start here” (this notebook);
  • Data holdings: a description of the data hosted on the platform;
  • Source counts over the sky: a simple example of querying and plotting;
  • TODO Mean proper motions over the sky: another simple example
  • Good astrometric solutions via ML Random Forest classifier: a more complex workflow demonstrating use of the Spark ML library in supervised machine learning;
  • TODO XXXX: 5d spatial clustering using HDBSCAN (unsupervised ML)

To load a notebook, click on the “Notebook” tab (above left) and select. Newcomers are advised to work through the set before attempting to use the system; have a quick look at the Zeppelin link in the previous cell first to get oriented in the User Interface and see also the “Zeppelin Tutorial” folder under the Notebooks tab.
